description: '''Noise pop''' is a [[subgenre]] of [[alternative rock|alternative]] and [[indie rock]] that emerged in the mid-1980s in the United Kingdom, originally pioneered by [[the Jesus and Mary Chain]] on their debut album ''[[Psychocandy]]''. Elements of the style were also present in some bands associated with the British [[C86]] movement. Noise pop later influenced the development of [[shoegaze]].
